label: Description
value: Sash of interlaced wool in pattern suggesting arrowhead. Known as 'ceinture flêche'.

label: Description
value: Short cylindrical cup (a) with loop handle; gray-white ground decorated with polychrome-painted oval scene showing classical ruin of building wall with arches; thin gilt border around oval; rim with underglaze blue band between two thin gilt lines; three incised concentric lines around base. Circular saucer (b) with gray-white ground decorated with central circular medalion surrounded by thin gilt border, showing classical ruin of wall with columns in landscape; rim with underglaze blue band between two thin gilt bands.

label: Dimensions
value: H x W x D (a: cup): 6.5 x 8.1 x 6.1 cm (2 9/16 x 3 3/16 x 2 3/8 in.) H x W (a,b: overall): 7.3 x 13 cm (2 7/8 x 5 1/8 in.) H x diam. (b: saucer): 2 x 13 cm (13/16 x 5 1/8 in.)

label: Provenance
value: 1949: acquired by Museum from Anonymous donor

label: Description
value: Short cylindrical cup (a) with loop handle; gray-white ground decorated with underglaze-painted oval medallion showing  view of walled city along riverbank; rim with underglaze blue band between two thin gilt lines; three incised concentric lines around base; handle with gold "U" and dots. Circular saucer (b) with gray-white ground decorated circular central medalion showing view of walled cities on water; rim with underglaze blue band between two thin gilt bands.

label: Provenance
value: 1949: acquired by Museum from Anonymous donor

label: Description
value: Cherub with outstretched arms, one leg forward, head facing to his right.  Pained wings.

label: Description
value: Head slightly lifted to its left. Wings extending from shoulders. Painted flesh colors, with pink and blue accents on wings.  Nail driven into back of head for suspension. Glass eyes

label: Description
value: Two cherubs’ heads, with wings growing out from shoulders. One, behind and above the other, has curly hair and parted lips showing two teeth. Painted in flesh colors, with pink and blue accents on wings. Glass eyes.

label: Description
value: Round knob of wood inlaid with silver in designs of three circles, formed by bands of stripes, dots and conventionalized figures.

label: Description
value: Round knob on short stem of wood, inlaid with silver. top has a star design; sides, stripes and zig-zags in circular bands; stem has perpendicular design of small conventionalized pattern and diamond in stripes.

label: Description
value: Small round knob, slightly flattened, set on short stem; wood inlaid in silver in completely conventionalized design; formed of small lines, dots in circular pattern or perpendicular pattern on stem.
Couturiere, from "Encyclopédie ou Dictionnaire Raisonné des Sciences, des Arts et des Métiers"

value: Transferred from Cooper Union Museum Picture Library (Kubler Collection)

Relieur, pl. I from "Encyclopédie ou Dictionnaire Raisonné des Sciences, des Arts et des Métiers"

label: Provenance
value: Transferred from Cooper Union Museum Picture Library (Kubler Collection)

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. George A. Kubler

label: Description
value: Scene of a cemetery at night.  The headless figure of the ghost of Simon Fraser, 11th Lord Lovat, walks in foreground towards the left wearing a monk's robes.  He holds his head in his left hand and a walking stick in his right.  Beneath the image is the title: Lovat's Ghost on Pilgrimage, followed by a satirical poem: Disguis'd thro' Life, a Layman at ye block, Doom'd for Crimes in Pilgrimage to Roam, Where Vanity Inscribes my Father's Tomb, My headless Trunk resumes ye Monkish Frock, With Weary Steps, I Seek my Native Home, But Justice Now Denies my Carcase Home.

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. George A. Kubler, New York, NY; 1949: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. George A. Kubler

label: Description
value: With an arched upper part. A donkey led by a monk carries a man and a woman. The man holds a wine glass in his left hand, raises his hat with his right hand and shouts "Huzza"; the woman holds a sword and a pack of cards marked "Harrington". In background, silhouette of London. Illustration for Ireland, "Graphic Illustrations…" I, 149.

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. George A. Kubler; 1949: acquired by the Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. George A. Kubler

label: Description
value: Engraving after a pen and ink drawing. A half-length portrait slightly turned toward right. The sitter wears a wig. Inscribed, lower center: Justice Welch. Illustration for Ireland, "Graphic Illustrations…" I, 155.

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. George A. Kubler; 1949: acquired by the Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. George A. Kubler

label: Description
value: A river landscape with a bridge and an arch. The bridge and tower drawn in wrong perspective. At right foreground, a tree, hills in background.

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. George A. Kubler; 1949: acquired by the Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. George A. Kubler

label: Description
value: Portrait of a colored girl in frontal view facing right. Half-length, she wears a kerchief on her head. Illustration for Ireland, "Graphic Illustrations…" I, 169.

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. George A. Kubler; 1949: acquired by the Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. George A. Kubler

label: Description
value: A portrait of a young woman in three-quarter view towards left. Helf-length, her hair is held together by a ribbon upon which is fastened the half-moon in front. Illustration for Ireland, "Graphic Illustrations…" I, 170.

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. George A. Kubler; 1949: acquired by the Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. George A. Kubler

label: Description
value: Seated figure of a man in frontal view. He (garrick) is dressed as a farmer; in his right hand he holds a long pipe. Illustration for Ireland, "Graphic Illustrations…" I, 171.

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. George A. Kubler; 1949: acquired by the Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. George A. Kubler

label: Description
value: An old man in side view towards right. Half-length, he holds in his right hand an opened book. He wears a white nightcap, white shirt and a dark coat. Illustration for Ireland, "Graphic Illustrations…" I, 172.

label: Physical description
value: Aquatint and etching in brown ink on paper

label: Provenance

label: Description
value: Etching after a pen drawing. A man (Wilkes) seated on a chair turned to left. With his left hand he supports a stick with a cap inscribed "Liberty". The original paper with torn corners. Illustration for Ireland, "Graphic Illustrations…" I, 176.

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. George A. Kubler; 1949: acquired by the Museum

label: Provenance
value: Transferred from Cooper Union Museum Picture Library (Kubler Collection)

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. George A. Kubler
Recueil d'ouvrages curieux de mathématique et de mécanique..., Plate 1

label: Description
value: Three mechanical objects on stands pierced with strapwork decoration, probably intended to be carried out in metal, or ivory. Two alternative schemes are given for the vertical members joining small, regularly-placed disc. Numbered fig. 1, 2, 3.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. George A. Kubler
Plate 2 of the Recueil d' ouvrages curieux de mathématique et de mécanique...

label: Description
value: Three mechanical objects, numbered 4, 5, and 6. The base of figure 4 is similar in design to figure 2 of Plate 1. The object, a solid ball inside a pierced one, is similar to one in figure 3, Plate 1. Figure 5 looks as if it may be fitted inside figure 6. Both are cylindrical in shape, figure 6 with a round bulge space at the bottom. These devices are pointed like tops; figure 4 looks as if it were meant to spin in some manner.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. George A. Kubler
Plate 3, from Recueil d'ouvrages curieux de mathématique et de mécanique, ou description du cabinet de Monsieur Grollier de Servière

label: Description
value: Designs for mechanical objects, to be carried out in metal or ivory. These are concentric geometrical shapes, the outer-most in each case being a sphere, with six holes facing front. Figure 11, in the center, is mounted on a tall spindle, with a trefoil or fleur-de-lys at the top of the sphere (similar to figure 10).

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. George A. Kubler; 1949: acquired by the Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. George A. Kubler
Plate 4, from Recueil d'ouvrages curieux de mathématique et de mécanique, ou description du cabinet de Monsieur Grollier de Servière

label: Description
value: Designs for mechanical objects to be carried out in metal or ivory. The central figure (12) is the largest, and like those in Plate 3, is spherical, but has more holes apparent. Inside are loose barrel-like shapes; figure 4, an indented sphere. Lower right, a quadrilateral triangle, with merging points. Lower left and righ, cubes.

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. George A. Kubler; 1949: acquired by the Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. George A. Kubler
Plate 5, from Recueil d'ouvrages curieux de mathématique et de mécanique, ou description du cabinet de Monsieur Grollier de Servière

label: Description
value: Seven designs for mechanical objects. Six are presumably able to be mounted on the stand for fig. 17, a sphere with a rod protruding laterally. Figure 23 is a sphere with circular gaps around a dimensional fleur-de-lys.

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. George A. Kubler; 1949: acquired by the Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. George A. Kubler
Plate 6, from Recueil d'ouvrages curieux de mathématique et de mécanique, ou description du cabinet de Monsieur Grollier de Servière

label: Description
value: A design for an urn, probably to be carried out in metal or ivory. The design is in ridges running vertically the height of the urn. The urn has three small legs at the base. Purpose unknown.

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. George A. Kubler; 1949: acquired by the Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. George A. Kubler
Plate 7, from Recueil d'ouvrages curieux de mathématique et de mécanique, ou description du cabinet de Monsieur Grollier de Servière

label: Description
value: A) A tri-footed container in two sections. The base is a large regular solid, above which the smaller section rests on three balls or solid sphere. The decorative design is like Plates 6 and 8. B) Another spherical object, crowned with a fleur-de-lys, which may fit inside A. Both to be carried out in metal or ivory.

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. George A. Kubler; 1949: acquired by the Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. George A. Kubler
Plate 8, from Recueil d'ouvrages curieux de mathématique et de mécanique, ou description du cabinet de Monsieur Grollier de Servière

label: Description
value: A design for a vase, urn, or container on a stem, the base supported by three feet. To be carried out in metal or ivory. The top forms a point made up of successfively smaller solid spheres.

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. George A. Kubler; 1949: acquired by the Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. George A. Kubler
Plate 9, from Recueil d'ouvrages curieux de mathématique et de mécanique, ou description du cabinet de Monsieur Grollier de Servière

label: Description
value: A squat container, design for metal on a base without feet. Above, two plans, C and D, probably for fitting the top and bottom.

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. George A. Kubler; 1949: acquired by the Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. George A. Kubler
Plate 10, from Recueil d'ouvrages curieux de mathématique et de mécanique, ou description du cabinet de Monsieur Grollier de Servière

label: Description
value: Designs for a container and related mechanical devices, to be carried out in metal or ivory. The top half is a cylinder, with a beaded point. The larger lower section rests on three feet. Left, a long (threaded?) spool, to the right, another. Above, a composit cylinidrical piece; small cylinder around a larger one.

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. George A. Kubler; 1949: acquired by the Museum

label: Description
value: Design for a container in two sections. Larger, lower piece on three legs, with woven slides, perhaps of metal or leather strips. The top section is similar, but narrorwer, crowned with the fleur-de-lys.

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. George A. Kubler; 1949: acquired by the Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. George A. Kubler
Plate 12 of the Recueil d' ouvrages curieux de mathématique et de mécanique...

label: Description
value: Four designs, the upper one similar to a large rosette, with radiating petal shapes, with frame alternately rounded and angled. Below, a small trefoil shape around a circle and small concentric hearts. Bottom, a sunburst becoming more geometrical. Numbered figs. 30, 31, 32, 33.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. George A. Kubler
